newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey imported car sales at 6-yr high Jan-April.
newsitem.headline: Turkey imported car sales at 6-yr high Jan-April.

text.p: The market share of imported cars sold in Turkey reached a six year high of 31 percent in the first four months of 1997, the automotive industry association (OSD) said on Thursday.

While overall car sales increased by 30 percent to 78,595 units, sales of locally produced cars increased by only 10 percent in to 54,558 in January-April, compared to the same period last year, the OSD said in its monthly report.

On the other hand, sales of imported cars more than doubled to 24,037 units. The market share of imported cars was 18 percent in the first four months of 1996 and six percent in the same period of 1995.
The OSD said car imports from the EU jumped by 134 percent and from the far east by 147 percent in the first four months of 1997, compared to last year.
Turkey's motor vehicle output slightly rose to 29,699 units in April, up 5.5 percent in April 1996 and car output fell 3.4 percent to 18,019 units in April, from the same month of 1996.
